newsitem.title: FRANCE: France praises accord in Central Africa.
newsitem.headline: France praises accord in Central Africa.

text.p: France on Wednesday praised the appointment of two nominees of former army mutineers to government posts in the Central African Republic as part of reconciliation measures after a series of bloody army revolts.

"France expresses its satisfaction at the conclusion between the Central African parties of an accord...that opens prospects for a peaceful solution to the crisis..." the Foreign Ministry said in a statement.
It urged the two sides to scupulously abide by the accord in order to take the country to reconciliation and recovery.

President Ange-Felix Patasse on Monday put former interior minister Lieutenant-Colonel Evariste Martial Konzale in charge of security and disarming civilians, and gave Brigadier-General Didas Ndayen, a former secretary of state for defence, the job of reorganising the army.
They will have the rank of minister-delegate.
The appointments followed talks between Patasse and leaders of troops who mutinied three times in less than a year.
French troops, in the country under a defence pact, restored order as the latest mutiny, which began in November, degenerated into ethnic bloodshed. They later handed over to African peacekeepers.
